oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of Col. William Shy, 20th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a pre-Civil War cased tintype of Col. William Shy, 20th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. He was killed at the Battle of Nashville on December 16, 1864 defending a hill top position which now bears his name. Shy was from the Del Rio Pike area of Williamson County. In the 1970s his body was unearthed from the family cemetery by relic hunters. His coffin was recovered and later his body re-interred. His metal coffin survives at the Carter House in Franklin, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Shy, William
